results.title: It's my party
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Randal Kleiser and Harry Knapp
results.brief_description: Nick Stark (Eric Roberts) is a Los Angeles architect who has it all - graced with vitality, good looks, loyal friends, a thriving career, a down-to-earth attitude and an irreverent sense of humor. Although he looks healthy, he has been fighting off AIDS related illnesses for years, and he discovers that he has untreatable brain lesions which will, at best, decimate all his brain faculties within days and he may die within a week. He intends to savour his remaining time by gathering everyone he loves for a two-day farewell party. Nick is a generous host to the diverse crowd he attracts. He draws his guests into a highly charged atmosphere where opinions collide, secrets spill, and old wounds heal as everyone struggles to accept Nick’s fate.

results.title: It's me, Claudia!
results.brief_description: A story about liking and accepting what you are. Adapted from the book by Alyse Newman. The story of Claudia, a nine-year-old girl who hated her big ears. One day Claudia found a large hat that covered her ears, eyes, nose and mouth. She couldn’t see anything, nor could she play games. Life got pretty lonely under the hat until the day she bumped into Paul.

results.title: It's Marty!
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Dennis Main-Wilson, Michael Mills and Roger Race
results.brief_description: Marty Feldman was the goggle-eyed clown whose innovative slap-stick humour helped usher in the anarchic age of Monty Python. Part Chaplin, part Keaton, part Python, he was the scriptwriter of “Round the Horne” for radio and “Bootsie and Snudge” for TV - who turned comic to take Hollywood by storm in movies with Mel Brooks & Gene Wilder, such as Young Frankenstein, Silent Movie and Yellowbeard. This video is a compilation of some of the very best of Marty Feldman, taken between the years of 1968 & 1969. It includes famous and often controversial sketches - The Cabbie ‘Squadron, The Loneliness of the long distance golfer, - these and others put his zany, surreal style on the map. The scriptwriters read like a roll-call of British comedy - Barry Took, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Terry Jones, Graham Chapman, and topping the list is Feldman himself. But then this is his show, a fitting tribute to a comic iconoclast. (Due to the archive nature of the material the sound and picture quality may vary occasionally, please do not adjust your set.)

results.title: It's like that
results.creator_credit: Southern Ladies Animation Group, Nicole McKinnon, Sharon Parker, Sophie Raymond, Louise Craddock, Susan Earl, Sally Gross, Emma Kelly, Kate Matthews, Elizabeth McLennan, Dell Stewart, Yuki Wada, Diana Ward and Justine Wallace
results.brief_description: This beautifully moving and poignant film depicts the plight and emotions of children held in Australian mandatory detention centres, seeking refugee status. Over a series of evocative animated images, one hears an array of children’s voices, describing their experiences of migrating from overseas and their detention in Australia. The children depicted as caged, migratory birds, reflect upon their environment, treatment and future. These interviews, conducted with three children being held in centres, clearly express the trauma of their experiences (both journeying to and once in Australia) and are heart-rending in their evocation of innocence abused. On completion of this film, in October 2003, these children remained in mandatory detention, awaiting their claims for refugee status to be processed.

results.title: It's just something kids do (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: La Trobe University Media Centre and Patricia Edgar
results.brief_description: Studies the effects of urbanisation on children’s play. Looks at the growth of adventure playgrounds and explains how they fall short of their counterparts in European countries. Furthermore, they are not a substitute for the natural environment.

results.title: It's just better
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew, Kathleen Shannon and Beverly Shaffer
results.brief_description: Mugs, mitts and toothbrushes hang from their respective nails, awaiting ten pairs of hands. At the farmhouse on Cape Breton Island where Shawn Peter Dwyer, age ten, lives with his mother and nine brothers and sisters, a team effort keeps the family functioning. The children work and play together. Their pockets are usually empty, but their lives are well filled. A useful film for the study of values and lifestyles.

results.title: It's in your power
results.brief_description: Designed to help farmers overcome some of the problems confronting their industry and the use and benefits of hand held electric tools in agriculture. Some methods of training in the use of the tools are shown during a visit to the Lackham School of Agriculture, Wiltshire; illustrates practical applications of these lessons with the tools in service arund the farm.

results.title: It's in the cards
results.brief_description: An industrial safety film for users of electical power machines. Teaches the importance and lifesaving value of “HOLD” cards. By putting this card on the main power switch of any machine, the repairman or worker assures himself that on-one will put the power on as long as the “HOLD” card hangs.

results.title: It's in the blood
results.brief_description: Sporting history runs in Darryl’s family. His grandfathers were champion cyclists Pat Veitch and Jack Forbes. His parents and his uncles also were all cycling enthusiasts and both Darryl and his brother inherited the sporting genes to become successful in athletics and football. It is this sporting background that Darryl feels has given him his values and made him what he is today.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: It's high time to lower cholesterol
results.creator_credit: Media Cast and National Heart Foundation of Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary arising out of the 7th International Symposium on Atherosclerosis, held in Melbourne 1985. This documentary examines atherosclerosis and focuses on how it develops, how it may be acquired, and steps that can be taken to reduce the risks of heart disease. The issue of lowering cholesterol by controlling the diet, eating a balanced diet with less fatty and high cholesterol foods and more vegetables and high fibre foods is stressed. Interviews with delegates to the symposium, cardiologists and dietitians are conducted.
